name: Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
address: inside Mahankal Mandir, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
A divine and unforgettable experience at Mahakaleshwar Temple! üôèüïâÔ∏è

Visited Mahakaleshwar Temple last Friday with family, and it was truly a spiritual journey. We drove üöó from Indore to Ujjain ‚Äì a smooth 2-hour drive. Thankfully, we had already booked our entry tickets online üé´. A helpful tip: make sure to carry a printoutüñ®Ô∏è of your entry pass, as mobile phones üìµ are not allowed inside the temple premises.

The darshan of the Jyotirlinga ‚Äì the only south-facing Jyotirlinga ‚Äì was a powerful and divine moment üî•. It is believed that Lord Shiva manifested here as a pillar of fire, and standing there in the sanctum felt truly sacred üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

After darshan, we took a walk through the temple corridor üõï, which showcases beautiful stone statues üóø of Lord Shiva‚Äôs various incarnations. The whole area was clean, peaceful, and well-managed üëç.

There are proper arrangements to deposit your chappals/slippers üë°üëû near the temple entrance and clean drinking water üíß is also available inside.

Highly recommend every devotee of Lord Shiva üïâÔ∏è to visit this sacred place at least once in their lifetime.
Har Har Mahadev! üôåüïâÔ∏è

One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, a place of immense spiritual energy, and a must-visit for Hindu pilgrims. Well managed, mainly the newly built Mahakal corridor and the facilities for devotees.  But lack of helpdesk or volunteer guidance. Bhasma Aarti, a unique early morning ritual, involving the offering of ashes to Mahakal. There will always be a rush however online boling is available including 'sheeghra darshan' at Rs. 250/- and many other Pujans. You can book for 'Rudrabhishek', dedicated Pandit will be assigned to do that. There is no specific dress code to enter the temple. Don't miss the 'Durlabh Darshan Kendra' at Mahakal corridor, a unique experience.

What should I mention about the place is the abode of Devo ke Dev Mahadev. The jyotirlinga is the only jyotirlinga which is South faced and it is believed that sacred sites where Lord Shiva is believed to have manifested as a pillar of fire. The devotees of Shiva are blessed and at least try to visit once. Chappals and slippers can be dropped inside temple entrance facilities there and even the facilities of drinking water is also there.
Har Har mahadev üïâÔ∏è

name: ISKCON Temple, Ujjain
address: Hare Krishna Land, 33-37, Administrative Zone, Bharatpuri, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text: very peaceful and calm place.. premises are well maintained and clean.. it also has nice garden.. mandir pandal and idols are mesmerising.. mandir administration is very strict with timings and other rules which is a good thing so do schedule your visit beforehand..

It's really a nice & soulful environment at Ujjain Iskcon. Beautiful aarti & decoration of flowers are awesome. Flowers has it's own importance & natural beauty infront it ornaments has no value...here very tasty jain foods are available which are extremely costly but very tasty. Veg roles are like complete dinner. Yes need little bit sanitation as they are using mobiles & notes in same hand serving food. Shoe stands are available. Once must visit....to feel the beauty of devotion. üôÇ

Clean Temple and omg loved the food there which we had at their restaurant Govinda‚Äôs
We had their aaloo parathas which I ordered twice and then harabhara kebab and juice as well. I would recommend you to visit that beautiful place indeed

name: Shri Kaal Bhairav Temple, Ujjain
address: Bhairavgarh, Goyala Buzurg, Madhya Pradesh 456003, India

reviews.text:
I recently visited this temple, what really caught my attention was the offering of liquor as prasad to the deity. ü§Ø

Though there was a bit of a crowd but the waiting time was absolutely worth it. I also saw people tying sacred threads on the railings, praying for their wishes to come true.

The vibe was peaceful and the whole place felt spiritual.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
Curious to know more? Read below the full story üëáüèª

Where liquor is offered to deity as prasad, and no one knows where it goes!

Located on the banks of the river Shipra, in the middle of a Hindu cremation ground, Shree Kal Bhairav in Ujjain is a six-thousand-year-old temple. The temple is five kilometers away from the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga. It is said that one‚Äôs visit to Ujjain is incomplete without a trip to this temple.

Surprisingly, there are no dry days at the Kal Bhairav temple, as liquor is offered to the deity as prasad. The priest sitting in front of the deity pours liquor into a plate and places it near the deity's mouth while chanting mantras in Sanskrit and performing tantrik rituals. The plate is tilted slightly, and the liquid gradually begins to vanish. Within a couple of minutes, the god can consume as much as a quarter bottle, even though there is no visible opening in the deity‚Äôs mouth.

The liquor offered to the deity forms one of the five rituals of tantra ‚Äì Madya (liquor), Mans (meat), Meen (fish), Mudra (gesture), and Maithun (copulation). Although several other deities across India receive alcohol as prasad, such as the Kali Mata temple in New Delhi and the Khabees Baba temple in Lucknow, only Kal Bhairav is supposed to possess the mysterious power of drinking liquor, and it remains a mystery where the liquid ends up.

Several archaeologists and scientists have made multiple attempts to unveil this mystery. Even during the British period, the entire temple was excavated to determine if the liquid flowed into a cavity, but the mystery remained unresolved. Some claimed that the porous stone used to carve the deity could absorb alcohol, but this theory has been disproven. Others suggested that the alcohol evaporates into the atmosphere, but the rate at which the deity consumes the alcohol does not support this argument. Devotees believe that Lord Kaal Bhairav himself drinks the alcohol, and the prasad returned to the devotees is said to have healing powers that can cure various ailments.

Outside the temple, liquor shops offer a variety of brands, where both men and women queue up to make their purchases. Hundreds of devotees visit the temple daily, some as pilgrims and others out of curiosity. The temple complex houses a Deepstambh adorned with oil lamps lit on special occasions.

We are in queue for 2-3 hours. As it was a Sunday the temple was very crowded. But the final darshan was very peaceful. Felt blessed.

The Kal Bhairav Temple in Ujjain is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Kal Bhairav, a fierce form of Lord Shiva. The temple's story is intertwined with mythology and local legends, particularly involving a clash between Brahma and Vishnu and Shiva's intervention as Kal Bhairav. It's also known for the unique ritual of offering liquor to the deity.

The divine Kaal Bhairav Temple was a 30 mins ride from the city of Ujjain. Located at the outskirts of the city, this place has a different vibe altogether! Had visited the temple on an auspicious weekend and the waiting queue was almost 1.5 hours but the crowd was very well managed and moved faster than expected. There are plenty of shops and 2 liquor stores outside this temple where you could buy the Aarati thali and other puja essentials.

The crazy part is there will be children selling water bottles by sitting on the dividers of the standing queue where you can buy water if you don‚Äôt have one!

Tip- If you‚Äôre visiting for the first time and in the day time, do carry a cap or dupatta to cover your head as it‚Äôs very sunny during the summers and you‚Äôve to wait in a long queue if there‚Äôs rush.

name: Shree Chintaman Ganesh Temple, Ujjain
address: 4PXQ+79H Chintaman Ganesh, 191, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Most people when entering Ujjain, will visit first this Ganesh temple.

Temple is very well maintained. You can get dharshan in very short time.

Parking facilities available.

Inside temple it is looking like a temple was in a small fort.

This temple is more then 6000 years old, very peaceful. its a believe that 1st invitation of marriage is given to Shree Chintaman Ganeshji. Shree Ganeshji will heal all tension of the couple. All new married couples comes 1st at the temple to take blessings from Shree Chintaman Ganeshji right after marriage.

Located 6 kms outside the Main Ujjain City, Plenty space for parking.
One of the oldest temples in Ujjain, biult accross Kshipra river.

name: Shree Harsiddhi Mata Shaktipeeth Temple
address: Harsiddhi Marg, Harsiddhi Chauraha, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Harsiddhi Temple in Ujjain is one of the most revered Shakti Peethas in India, deeply rooted in Hindu mythology and spiritual tradition. Located close to the famous Mahakaleshwar Temple, it is dedicated to Goddess Harsiddhi, an incarnation of Goddess Durga. The temple holds significant religious importance and is believed to be the spot where Goddess Sati‚Äôs elbow fell, making it a powerful spiritual site for devotees.

The architecture of the temple reflects the Maratha style, with its striking red tower (shikhara) and intricately carved structures. The presence of the Sri Yantra, symbolizing divine feminine energy, and an ancient well within the premises adds to its historical and mystical appeal. The temple is especially famous for its two majestic deepstambhas (lamp pillars), which are lit with hundreds of oil lamps during evening aarti, creating a divine and captivating ambiance.

Visitors often describe the experience as spiritually uplifting, especially during Navratri when the temple is beautifully decorated and crowded with devotees. The temple is well-maintained, easily accessible, and offers a peaceful atmosphere despite its popularity. Whether you're a devotee or a traveler interested in cultural heritage, Harsiddhi Temple offers a memorable and soul-stirring experience.

Hara Siddhi Mata temple was built by King Vikramaditya in honor of the femine divine energy. According to Siva Puranam One of the Shakthi peethams where the elbow of Goddess Sati is believed to be fallen.
Morning 7.00-7.30 and evening 6.30-7.30 temple authorities lighten diyas which looks amazing and happy. Devotees also light diyas infront of the temple where space given. Some Devotees perform abhisheka to Lord Siva linga which was present In the premises. We visited at the time of Sivaratri.

The Harshidhhi Mata Temple in Ujjain is a revered Shaktipeeth, steeped in mythological and historical significance. It is believed that the elbow of Goddess Sati fell here, making it one of the 51 sacred Shaktipeeths in India. The temple showcases striking Maratha architectural influences, evident from the towering deepstambhas (lamp pillars) that are beautifully lit during festivals. These tall lamp pillars, built by the Marathas, are rare architectural elements not commonly found in other Ujjain temples. Inside the sanctum, the idol of Harshidhhi Mata is flanked by idols of Annapurna and Mahalakshmi, forming a unique trinity of feminine power. A lesser-known fact is that the temple gained prominence during the reign of the Maratha rulers who renovated and elevated its status as a central shrine in Ujjain. The temple is located near the famous Mahakaleshwar Temple, forming a spiritual circuit for pilgrims visiting Ujjain. Local traditions include lighting 1,000 oil lamps on Amavasya (new moon) nights as an offering to the goddess. The peaceful courtyard and minimal commercialization around the temple create a serene spiritual experience for visitors. Beyond religion, the temple is a symbol of feminine strength and the region‚Äôs syncretic cultural heritage.

name: Shri Dwarkadhish Gopal Mandir Ujjain
address: Mahakaal Temple, Patni Bazar, Kamri Marg, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text: The main temple has a two-feet tall statue of Lord Krishna made up of silver coated marble. In addition to Lord Krishna's idol, there are also idols of Lord Shiva, Parvati and Garuda. Janmashtami and Harihar Parva are celebrated with great pomp in this temple complex. In the Harihar Parva, images of Mahakaleshwar jyotirlinga are brought in to meet Lord Krishna. The doors of Gopal Mandir are said to have been stolen by Mahmud of Ghazni. These were later restored by Mahadji Scindia.

Good place to visit at anytime of the day.
Its peaceful
Nothing much to explore here but what is has is already sufficient to visit this place.
Do get mehndi from shops outside the mandir, these are famous in ujjain, not many people will tell you about this only the local people know these small things.

Very beautiful temple of krishnaji.
It gives you a feel of ancient temples.
Well maintained and peaceful atmosphere.
Very vibrant and colorful. It has parikrama space outside enough for 1 person at a time.
It gives a old , slow life vibes with no voice inside premises even though it is located in market area with heavy traffic.
It has enough space to sit around , a good angan and rooms around.
It has no waiting area and you can sit as much as you can without anyone bothering you.
Must visit once if you visit ujjain.

name: Bharat Mata Temple, Ujjain
address: 5QJ9+8MX, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
The Bharat Mata Temple in Ujjain offers a unique and thought-provoking experience, quite different from the typical temple visit. Instead of deities, this temple is dedicated to the personification of India as a mother goddess ‚Äì Bharat Mata. Stepping inside, you're immediately struck by the imposing and intricately carved statue of Bharat Mata herself, holding a map of undivided India.
The atmosphere within is less about traditional religious fervor and more about patriotic reverence. It evokes a sense of national pride and historical awareness. The walls are adorned with depictions of significant figures and events from India's history, offering a visual journey through the nation's past. While it might not be a place for conventional worship, it serves as a powerful reminder of the country's rich heritage and the sacrifices made for its freedom.
The temple complex is generally well-maintained, and the serene environment allows for quiet contemplation. It's a place that encourages reflection on the unity and diversity of India. For those interested in history, culture, and a different perspective on national identity, the Bharat Mata Temple in Ujjain is definitely worth a visit. It provides a refreshing and meaningful experience beyond the usual pilgrimage.

Must visit and stay here for some time specially if you are married with family or solo .. worth every second of life ..very close 15feet from mahakaal baba temple Ujjain and very near is mahakaal corridor.. can't wait to visit again . Jai bharat mata üôè‚ù§Ô∏èhar har Mahadev üïâÔ∏èüî± jai shree mahakaal ‚ù§Ô∏è

Bharat mata ki jai... Just at the entry gate 1 of maha kaleshwar mandir this temple is existing.   This is dedicated to Bharath Mata or goddess of India.   The map of india is well executed  as a big mural and there is sufficient space to walk and enter. I recommend you to if you visit ujjain try to come here also . So peaceful place

name: Angareshwar Mahadev Mandir, Ujjain (43/84)
address: mandir, Angareshwar Mahadev(43/84), Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
This temple is considered as Original Birth Place of Mangal(Mars).
People those have Mangal Dosha(evil Mars effect) they offered puja with curd rice to minimize evil effects of Mangal.
We also performed our puja on 18-04-2025,21-04-2025 and 22-04-2025.
The temple has nice atmosphere.
Here you can do pooja for all your planets like Rahu, Ketu, Mangal , Kalsarpdosh and every planet whichever is weak in your kundli.

Angareshwar Mahadev is one of the most famous temples for Mangal-related poojas, believed to remove obstacles and negative influences. The ‚Çπ2100 pooja we performed was conducted very well by a knowledgeable pandit ji, who explained each step thoroughly.

To avoid traffic, it's best to take a right turn before entering Ujjain Gate. The temple also has a goshala, adding to its peaceful environment. While Pitra Pooja is done at Siddhvat, one should be mindful of charges, as poojas start from ‚Çπ100-200, but we ended up paying much more than needed.

Angareshwar sees a huge crowd, and the pooja process moves quickly. As soon as one group completes their rituals, another takes their place. Even at the Shivling, multiple people perform pooja together, followed by another group almost instantly. While this rush is inevitable, it‚Äôs something to be aware of when visiting.

Despite the crowd, the spiritual energy here is strong, making it a must-visit for those seeking relief from Mangal dosh and other obstacles.

name: Jai Maa Gadhkalika Mata Mandir Ujjain
address: 1 Gadkalika Mandir, near Sthirman Ganesh, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text: I visited Gadh Kalika Temple recently, and it was quite busy that day. The temple is located on Bhairav Hill, and despite the crowd, it still had a spiritual vibe. The idol of Goddess Kalika is beautifully decorated, and the architecture of the temple is impressive. Even though there were many people, the surroundings still offered a peaceful space for prayer and reflection. It‚Äôs a meaningful visit if you‚Äôre in Ujjain, but be prepared for a bit of a crowd.

This sacred temple, a revered Shaktipeeth, is dedicated to Goddess Kalika and serves as a source of spiritual energy, inspiring individuals to engage in virtuous acts and cultivate a deeper understanding of spirituality.

Indore is a divine entry to spiritual abode Ujjain..
The temple darshan was very welcoming. Devi roop is apratim. Ujjain is a complete treat for darshan...starting with Mahakaleshwar Bhairav baba...harsiddh devi..Mangal mandir..Jai Maa gadkalika...Bow to all God's..peace be to all

name: Shri Chaubis Khamba Mata Temple, Ujjain
address: 24, Gudri Chouraha, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
As the name suggests itself "Chaubis Khanba" means 24 pillars. I visited the temple with high expectations, however to be honest I was let down a bit. Not well organised it's barely even a temple to be honest. And it's not even like there are 24 pillars in one row decorated beautifully, instead it's almost like a left over ruins of an old architecture, some pillars over here and there and barely noticeable.

A one time visit place that's all in my honest opinion. The front gate is still a bit attractive and beautiful for consideration.

I would still certainly appreciate the peace and the naturality of the place. No beggars in front or at the corners. The place is very tidy as well and almost no crowd at all.

All in all: 3/5 ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Temple of Maa Durga in choubis khanba 24 pillars of old fort type building. It‚Äôs situated on the way to Mahakal lok corridor.

Shri Chaubis khamba mata mandir is very well known place in ujjain. This temple is located near (500meter)mahakaleshwar jyotirlinga.
Chaubis khamba mata mandir's around many hotels and restaurants available for stye and food.
Ujjain's food is very testy like a waooo...

Jai Shri Mahakal

name: Shri Char Dham Temple
address: Chardham Mandir, Ganesh Colony, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Open from 6AM to 10 PM.

I had a bus to catch to travel from Ujjain to Omkareshwar early in the morning at 7:40. I had some spare time as the bus was about to leave in 25 minutes. I thought of utilising this time to visit this nearby temple.

As the name suggests "4 Dhaam Temple", it's got God statues of all 4 dhams in the country. It's also got a small cave and other beautiful idols as well. Clean, peaceful, beautiful, and natural beauty as well ‚ù§

Place is well maintained and has a calming vibration. It has replicas of chardham and 12 jyothirlingas. For people who cant go to the chardhams, they can experince them at an energy level in this place. There is also a cave structure where Navadurga statues are kept. All the idols in this place are beautifully carved.

A nice place for spiritual seekers. There is also a meditation space. CHILDREN might find this place interesting.

Note: There is an entrance fee for cave and not the chardham.

Good temple. Imitations of 4 dhams are situated here. Also a good cave temple with monuments is situated.
This temple opening timing is 6 AM to 10 PM

name: Mangalnath Mandir
address: Ankpat Marg, Mangalnath Mandir, Agar Rd, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456010, India

reviews.text: Mangalnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is believed to be the birthplace of Mars (Mangal) according to the Matsya Purana. The temple is famous for its serene environment and the panoramic view of the Kshipra River. Spiritual significance and beautiful view of the Kshipra River.

Really liked this place. Located by the Shipra River, it has a calm and spiritual vibe. It‚Äôs believed to be the birthplace of Mars (Mangal), and as per lokkotha (folk belief), pujas here help reduce Mangal dosh. The surroundings are open and airy, and the temple feels powerful yet peaceful inside. Some priests may suggest special pujas, but overall, the experience felt genuine. A must-visit if you‚Äôre into astrology or want a quiet, divine atmosphere.

Very nice.
This temple is located in Ujjain and considered to remove evil effects of Mars(Mangal Dosha).This temple is considered as Birth place of Mangal(Mars).
People offered card rice to minimize evil effects of Mangal(Mars).
Several types of puja (Navgraha Shanti,Mangal Shanti,Rahu Ketu shanti)is done here.
Arka Vivaha for Man (marriage conducted with tree)and Kumbha Vivaha (marriage conducted with earthen pot) for woman is also done here.
People believed that they will have peaceful life after completing the puja.
Pandit Akshay Bharti and his team is conducting the puja.
We also performed puja here on 18-04-2025,21-04-2025 and 22-04-2025.
We have aa wonderful experience!

name: Mangal Temple Ujjain | Mangal Dosh Puja Ujjain
address: Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
I recently visited the Mangalnath Temple, which is located quite far from Nanakheda. You will need to pay around ‚Çπ100 for an auto to reach the temple. This place is especially known for the Mangal Shanti Pooja. As I am Manglik, I came here for the pooja. There are three types of poojas offered:

Normal Pooja - ‚Çπ1100, with an additional ‚Çπ200 for the receipt.

Medium Pooja - ‚Çπ2100, with ‚Çπ200 for the receipt. This pooja takes around 1 to 1.5 hours.

Complete Pooja - ‚Çπ5100, with ‚Çπ500 for the receipt. This pooja takes about 3 hours, and during it, you get "married" to a plant.

The Puranas claim that Mars is Earth‚Äôs child. In other words, Mars is a planet that evolved from Earth. According to Hindu myths, Mangala is created when Lord Shiva melts. According to Mahant Rajendra Bharti, the name ‚ÄúUgra‚Äù refers to the planet Mars‚Äô natural name. Astrology is based on the twelve zodiac signs, planets, constellations, etc.

The Mangalnath mandir is dedicated to Lord Mangalnath.   Most of the people who are having Mangalik dosh comes here and does puja for the Mangalnath deity.    The temple is two layered and with steps you have to reach the temple in the top .   The lower level is used by the pandits to do the puja and also there is a permanent havan going on with woodden log in the area abetting the main temple.   A new tower is built recently like a minar with colourful sections an added attaction of the temple.   Beware of pandits they will quote various charges after completing the puja .  Have all inclusive charges fixed before starting the havan.

name: Shree Mahakal Mahalok Ujjain
address: 5QH9+QP8, Mahakal Lok Corridor Rd, Begampura, Bagambag Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text: Mahakal Lok in Ujjain is a divine and grand place, enhancing the spiritual experience of devotees visiting the Mahakaleshwar temple. The beautifully crafted statues and pillars narrate stories from Lord Shiva's life, creating a powerful spiritual vibe. The corridor is vast, clean, and well-maintained, making it perfect for a peaceful walk. Evening lighting adds a magical touch, making the entire place glow with devotion. The management ensures smooth darshan and provides ample facilities. Overall, Mahakal Lok offers a soulful experience, making it a must-visit for every devotee and tourist.

A Divine Journey to the Heart of Shiva:
Stepping into the Mahakal Corridor in Ujjain is akin to embarking on a profound spiritual pilgrimage, even before reaching the sacred Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga itself. This magnificent expansion truly elevates the devotional experience, preparing the mind and soul for the divine presence of Lord Shiva.
From the moment you enter through the grand Nandi Dwar or Pinaki Dwar, a sense of sacredness envelops you. The sprawling pathways, meticulously designed and well-lit, guide devotees with grace, allowing for a comfortable and immersive journey. What truly sets this corridor apart is the breathtaking array of intricately carved sculptures. Over 100 divine stories of Lord Shiva unfold before your eyes, each a testament to ancient wisdom and artistic mastery. Walking amidst these depictions, chanting "Jai Shree Mahakal," feels like traversing through the very legends of the cosmos, connecting deeply with the divine Leelas of Bholenath.
The 108 ornate sandstone columns, each adorned with the divine 'Trishul' and various 'mudras' of Lord Shiva, create an aura of reverence. The 192 statues and 53 murals further enhance this immersive experience, making the path to the main temple a visual and spiritual feast. One can't help but feel a palpable sense of peace and positive energy radiating from every corner.
Beyond the aesthetic beauty, the corridor's thoughtful design facilitates a smoother darshan experience, even amidst large crowds. The seamless blend of divinity, comfort, and heritage preservation is truly commendable. The gentle sounds of temple bells, the murmuring of sacred chants, and the flowing Kshipra River nearby all contribute to a serene and tranquil atmosphere, making it a powerful preparatory journey for the ultimate devotion at the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga.
For any devotee of Lord Shiva, the Mahakal Corridor is more than just an approach to the temple; it is an integral part of the spiritual odyssey. It allows one to absorb the essence of Mahakal, to reflect on His boundless glory, and to arrive at the sanctum sanctorum with a heart brimming with pure devotion. It is a testament to faith, a bridge to the divine, and an experience that truly nourishes the soul. A must-visit for every seeker of blessings and spiritual enlightenment.

Lovely area. Majestic monuments. Various glimpses of Shivas life. Very good facility and food counter available. Government has made excellent arrangements for senior citizens and people with difficulty in mobility. Free electric vehicles are available to ferry them from gate to the Temple and and route one can see the entire mahaloka. Staff and driver all very very humble there was no wait time during the weekdays.

name: Shri Ram Ghat
address: 5QP7+CHX, Ram Ghat Marg, Kartik Chowk, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Ram Ghat is a serene and spiritually uplifting place, especially during sunrise and sunset. The view of the temples and the ghat against the backdrop of a golden sky creates a mesmerizing experience. The peaceful atmosphere, the sound of temple bells, and the river‚Äôs calm flow make it a perfect spot for relaxation and reflection.

Whether you‚Äôre visiting for religious purposes or just to soak in the beauty of the surroundings, Ram Ghat offers a blend of divinity and tranquility. The well-lit area in the evening, along with the gentle breeze, makes it a great place to sit and unwind. Definitely a must-visit if you‚Äôre in the area!

Open 24x7 üòä

Peaceful, less crowded, beautiful, temples near the ghat, street foodüç≤, fountain‚õ≤. Simply loved it

A humble request to everyone who visits this place, please don't throw any garbageüöÆ or plastic on the sacred Shipra River üåä maintain hygiene and only throw on a dustbin.

Shri Ram ghat is approx 1km from Mahakaleshwar temple. It is the oldest bathing ghat. Shira Aarti held every evening which is the most memorable moment in this ghat. Built on river Kshipra's coast, Ram Mandir Ghat holds great religious importance as one of the four sacred sites for the Kumbh Mela, celebrated every 12 years..

name: Nagchandreshwar Mandir
address: mahakaaleshwar jyotirling, Jaisinghpura, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text: This is the temple which opens just for 24 hours once in a year on "Naag panchmi" this time it was on 5th august.. it was my second time to visit the temple and every time the experience is getting much better. üòä it is to be said that any kind of Kaal sarp dosh can be removed only after the visit to this Temple as there is a story behind this temple and that is said that when Nagraj takshak worshipped Lord Shiva and blessed to be immortal forever and he wants that he is not to be disturbed frequently. Hence to fulfill his wish the temple opens once in a year and the Nagraj takshak presents there on this day to bless everyone. üòä

The Nagchandreshwar Temple is located in Ujjain, India. It's a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its association with the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga, one of the twelve revered Jyotirlingas. Devotees visit this temple to seek blessings and offer their prayers to Lord Shiva. It's known for its unique architecture and the presence of a naturally formed shivling (a symbolic representation of Lord Shiva) surrounded by numerous serpents.
Why don't Temple Committee & Government use Crpf or Ncc to manage the crowd !! Pathetic Management. Male & Female line must be categorised

name: Ujjain Temple
address: 15, Kakriya Parisar, near Cheritable Hospital, Awantipura, Geeta Colony, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456001, India

reviews.text:
Ujjain, considered to be one of the holiest cities of India, is an ancient city situated on the eastern bank of the Shipra River in the Malwa region of Madhya Pradesh. Ujjain is one of the four sites for the Kumbh Mela, the largest peace-time gathering on the planet that attracts 100 million people to the festival.

This makes Ujjain an important place of Hindu Pilgrimage. To add to that, it is also home to the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga, one of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines to the god Shiva. Ujjain is one of the most glorious cities of ancient India as it was also known to be the educational hub of various Indian scholars. The immense wealth of Ujjain in terms of religion, architecture, and educational value makes this is a top attraction amongst not only Indian travellers but also amongst foreign tourists as well. Ujjain is located at a distance of 52 km from Indore, which is also the nearest major airport.

name: Shri Avanti Parshwanath Jain Shwetambar Tirth- Ujjain
address: 5QQ8+WR8, Chandrashekhar Azad Marg, Danigate, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Very big and excellent temple. Amazing facts are associated with the temple history. Pratimaji of Parshwa Prabhu is Divine and excellent. It's 108 Parshwanath Tirth. Near to Ujjain railway station. Very good facialities of Dharmashala and Bhojanshala. Pethi sanchalaks and Bhojanshala staff are very cooperative and humble.
A must Visit.

If you are someone who is looking for a budget trip and somebody who wants the hotel to be near this is the best option. You can opt for the rooms are pretty good. Not so amazing like an hotel, but it has pretty amazing space washrooms are clean, and the bed is fine. You can definitely opt for this. From here, the temples are quite nearer like half kilometre, 1 km, one and half kilometre, yeah.

It is in middle of ujjain,this is very old jain pilgrimage,the temple is very beautifully carved of marble and has very interesting carvings,the tirth also has facilities like bhojanashaala, dharamshala, parking

name: Ram Janardan Temple
address: 6Q6H+2G9, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
Unexplored beautiful ancient temple.

Here Janardan and Janaki two separate big temple is there. Before this temple a big pond is there. Here many small temple of Shiva is there.

During rain, first this pond will filled with water. After that it is going down to a big lake.

Near Lake, park is there for small children.

Beautiful temple and maintained by ASI.

The temple is reportedly unique temple wherein Lord Rama and Laxmana are found to be sporting beard and moustache. It signifies the period of Vanavasa in the life of Lord Rama.  iThe temple is more than 250 years old. It's a part of temple complex on the shores of Vishnu Sagar Lake in Ujjain. The temple is enclosed in a compound. The temple is built on raised platform. There is a Vishnu temple nearby.

If you want to spend sometime being yourself amid the chaos of stressful life thn Shri Ram Janardan Mandir is the best place. Situated in the old avantika shetra surrounded by lush greenery and Vishnu Sagar Lake, the temples were built in 17th century. The premises hold several small temples too devoted to Mahadev , Ganpati ji and Hanuman ji.

name: Maharishi Sandipani Ashram
address: Maharshri sandipani aashram, Sri Sarveshwar Mahadeva Temple, Mangalnath Marg, Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh 456006, India

reviews.text:
I have visited this place few years back.

But this time I was wondering, how much changes in this temple.

Temple is very well maintained. I can't explain by words.

You can by my experience only feel this place.

This Ashram consists of a big hall with painting, three temple, 64 arts learning by Krishna in beautiful arts, Bhagwat Gita and big pond with big park and canteen.

Ashram is very well maintained.

Always here rush will be there.

Sandipani Ashram is a sacred and historical place located in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, India. It is traditionally believed to be the gurukul (ancient school) where Lord Krishna, along with his brother Balarama and friend Sudama, received his education under the sage Guru Sandipani.

This place still takes you to that era when lord Sri Krishna was born.  Exclusive Indian out of the historical knowledge that one expects.  It is said that lord Krishna finish this education in this place.  There is plenty of evidence which can prove this.  A place with full of positive energy.
